snippet: The manner in which the police identified the officer involved in the death of Michael Brown and released evidence that Mr. Brown was a suspect in a robbery renewed tension in the Missouri town.
abstract: Missouri police identify Darren Wilson as the officer involved in the shooting death of teenager Michael Brown, simultaneously releasing evidence that Brown was a suspect in a convenience store robbery before he was shot; manner in which information is released renews tensions in Ferguson, Mo; day is dominated by two news conferences, one led by white officer Thomas Jackson who seemed ill at ease and another by a black officer, Capt Ronald S Johnson, who expressed solidarity with the crowd while pleading for peace.

byline.original: By TANZINA VEGA, TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Tanzina Vega reported from Ferguson, and Timothy Williams and Erik Eckholm from New York. Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting from New York, and Brent McDonald from Ferguson.

lead_paragraph: The manner in which the police identified the officer involved in the death of Michael Brown and released evidence that Mr. Brown was a suspect in a robbery renewed tension in the Missouri town.

headline.main: Emotions Flare in Missouri Amid Police Statements
headline.print_headline: Dueling Police Statements as Anger Rises in Missouri
